etymologies: early 18th century; earliest use found in William Salmon (1644–1713), medical empiric and author. From post-classical Latin otalgicus from Hellenistic Greek ὠταλγικός (variant reading in Dioscorides) from ὠταλγία + -ικός

definitions: Used for the treatment of otalgia; of, relating to, or associated with otalgia.
